meanings.definition: The state or quality of being thin or undernourished.
meanings.sent1: Her scrawninesses made her look fragile and weak.
meanings.sent2: The scrawninesses of the stray cat indicated it needed food.
meanings.sent3: Despite his scrawninesses, he tried to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent4: The scrawninesses of the tree branches made them sway in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The scrawninesses of the model shocked the audience at the fashion show.

meanings.definition: The condition of lacking muscle or body mass.
meanings.sent1: His scrawninesses were evident when he struggled to lift the weights.
meanings.sent2: The scrawninesses of the marathon runner helped him move swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The scrawninesses of the wrestler surprised his opponents.
meanings.sent4: The scrawninesses of the plant made it bend towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The scrawninesses of the actor were noticeable on screen.

meanings.definition: The appearance of being frail or emaciated.
meanings.sent1: The scrawninesses of the old man made him seem delicate.
meanings.sent2: Her scrawninesses were a result of her strict diet.
meanings.sent3: Despite his scrawninesses, he had a big appetite.
meanings.sent4: The scrawninesses of the scarecrow made it look eerie in the field.
meanings.sent5: The scrawninesses of the character in the movie portrayed his struggle.
